page.title: 01Rolvenden : A General Review
page.content: This area takes in the villages of {Rolvenden and Rolvenden Layne}and is mainly rural in character. The nearest town is Tenterden, 3 miles to the north-east, on the main A28 (Hastings to Ashford) road. Running from north to south across the area is Newmill Channel, which is a tributary of the River Rother. This low-lying area of marshland has been drained more and more in recent years. About 1,200 people live here and about 60% work in agriculture. { Rolvenden}has a County Primary School, a Church, a Village Hall and Recreation Ground. There is a Post Office, convenience goods shops, a garage and 2 public houses.{Rolvenden {Layne}has fewer facilities but it does have a pub, Post Office, shop and playing field. Rolvenden was judged the Best Kept Village in Kent in l985.
